intro: Cryptantha mohavensis, commonly known as the Mohave cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as along washes and in desert scrub. It has a low, spreading growth habit with narrow, linear leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
